latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Sanchez, Loretta amendment (A012) Failed by recorded vote: 167 - 249 (Roll no. 354).
On agreeing to the Sanchez, Loretta amendment (A020) Failed by recorded vote: 182 - 237 (Roll no. 331). (consideration: CR H3517-3518)
On agreeing to the Sanchez, Loretta amendment (A036) Failed by recorded vote: 184 - 234 (Roll no. 369). (consideration: CR H3732)
On agreeing to the Sanchez, Loretta amendment (A009) Agreed to by voice vote.
On agreeing to the Sanchez, Loretta amendment (A004) Failed by voice vote.

Mr. Hensarling raised a point of order against the Sanchez, Loretta amendment (A004). Mr. Hensarling stated that the provisions of the amendment exceed the scope of the bill and the amendment is therefore,not germane. The Chair sustained the point of order.

Mrs. Biggert raised a point of order against the Sanchez, Loretta amendment (A007). Mrs. Biggert stated that the amendment had the effect of increasing mandatory spending over a specified period of time and violated clause 10 of rule 21. The Chair sustained the point of order.
